cyclone.name: NATE
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles SSE of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border (and 60 miles W of San Andres Island)
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to continue northwest across Nicaragua and Honduras on Thursday, emerge into the north-western Caribbean Friday, strengthen in the Gulf of Mexico, and move N-NE toward the northern Gulf Coast this weekend before curving inland across the Southeast toward the Mid-Atlantic early next week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast (most likely Mississippi–Alabama coastline)

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A for U.S. coast at this time; tropical-storm warning confined to Sandy Bay Sirpi, Nicaragua to Punta Castilla, Honduras
weather_observation.warning_coast: N/A for U.S. coast at this time; same as above
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary threat this weekend along the northern Gulf Coast, then inland across AL, GA, the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic (including Chesapeake Bay region) early next week
weather_observation.wind: Chances of sustained gale (34 kt) winds are very low (≤3%); breezy conditions with gusts 25–35 mph possible as remnants pass.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in Baltimore Harbor/upper Chesapeake based on current track and depression strength.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain (2–4 in.) possible Mon–Tue with localized ponding/urban runoff.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated short-lived tornadoes or waterspouts cannot be ruled out in the Mid-Atlantic if remnant center passes nearby.
